4: What is the difference between static websites and dynamic websites? [from a UI perspective]
Static website cannot accept UI inputs while dynamic websites can and update the webpage based on UI input
5: What are is the constrain of dynamic websites that have UI inputs to update components of a webpage?
Dynamic websites puts constrain on the DOM by having the DOM tree be re-rendered everytime an eventListener detects changes. This has performance issues.
6: Why are todo list apps ideal for testing new frameworks or libraries?

It provides a way to exhibit how the CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) behaviors are implemented using a specific technology. 
	[]_Add new item to the list (create) 
	[]_View the existing list (Read)
	[]_Change the completion status of each item (update)
	[]_remove items from the list (Delete)

9: What are Objects in the Js world?
Objects are dynamic collections of attributes with properties (pairs of keys and values)
10: In Js are the keys of string data type (dt) only?
No in Js you can have the keys be either a string or variable - however the common practice is to omit the use of strings for keys
11: In a typical MVC monolithic application what is actually being sent to the frontend when an http request is made?
files are being send typically HTML, CSS, and JavaScript files.
12: What is the difference between http and ftp servers?
FTP servers can send files of any type where as http is restricted to html,css,Js,images,and videos file formats.
13: what are the three things included in a url address?

The protocol, which states which protocol is being used to access the content be it either http, https, or ftp, the domain which states the IP address and finally the path which refers to a file or location on the server. The path can also include parameters for querying purposes.
14: What does JS allow you to do on the DOM when there is content?
Allows you to manipulate the content (html)El), style (css), and structure (html) of a webpage
15: What are the numerious ways that you can select an el from the DOM using Js?

document.getElementById()
		[]_allows you to select el by id ATTR
		[]_returns htmlEl
	document.getElementsByClassName()
		selects all el that contain the same value for the class ATTR
		[]_returns an arr of htmlEl
	document.getElementsByTagName()
		[]_selects all el by tag name in the order that they appear on the DOM
		[]_returns an arr of htmlEl
	document.querySelector()
		[]_selects el by selectorValue of either tag name, class value, or id value
		[]_returns an htmlEl
	document.querySelectorAll()
		returns an arr of el by selectorValue

17: In general what are the common technologies used in the tech industry for frontend development?
HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React angular or Vue, webpack, Babel, NPM, and git with github.
18: Webpack is a module bundler that helps manage and optimize the assets of a web application and babel is a js compiler that allows developers to use newer versions of js and write code in a way that is compatible with older browsers -- i.e. converts new js to older versions.
19: How do you optimize the performance of a web page?
minimize the frequency of HTTP requests, minimize the size of assets, caching resources, using CDN, and code optimization
20: Explain the advantage of caching resources to improve web page performace.
By caching resources, the browser can reuse them on subsequent page loads, reducing the number of HTTP requests and the amount of data that needs to be transferred.
21: Does the order of loading assets effect the performance of a web page? Explain your reasoning.
Yes--the order in which assets are loaded can have a significant impact on the performance of a web page.
22: Explain how a CDN (content delivery network) impacts the performance of a web page.
A CDN can help improve the performance by serving assets from a server location that is closer to the user.
23: How can you get a nested el within an html el that acts as either a container or is a parent el?

Using either the parentNodes method or the querySelector method. 
	parentNode method:
		`const parent = document.getElementById("parentEl");
		const child = parent.<childNodes, firstChild, lastChild>`

	querySelector method:
		`const child = parent.querySelector(<val>)`
